fields.description:
If JIRA is configured for HTTPS connections (in both "redirect HTTP to HTTPS" and "HTTPS only" modes), then the following redirects are possible. This does not occur in HTTP configs. 

The {{os_destination}} parameter on the {{login.jsp}} page (and other pages once logged in - see technical details below) allows you to redirect to any site if the URL is prefixed with two slashes.

*Reproduction*
* Browse to the following link (replacing {{jira.example.com}} with your own test server).
* *https*://jira.example.com/login.jsp?os_destination=%2F%2Fatlassian.com
* Log in, and see that your browser is redirected to atlassian.com.

*Example reque*
{code}HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
X-AREQUESTID: 903x5883x1
X-ASESSIONID: lw2agc
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT
X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK
Location: https://atlassian.com
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length: 0
Date: Tue, 22 Apr 2014 22:03:47 GMT{code}

I was only able to get redirects to work if the redirect URL begins with {{//}} (or {{%2F%2F}} when URL-encoded). Having special characters (such as the colon in {{http://}}) will redirect the user to the dashboard page, so it seems you can't redirect to the user to links with any other protocols.

If the user is already logged in, it doesn't seem to matter which page the {{os_destination}} parameter is on. Even if it's a page that doesn't exist, it will still redirect the user immediately. For example:
https://jira.example.com/ThisCanBeAnything?os_destination=%2F%2Fatlassian.com
https://jira.example.com/AnythingYouWant?os_destination=%2F%2Fatlassian.com

I tested this on versions 5.2.11, 6.2, and 6.2.2, but other versions are likely vulnerable as well.

*Solution*
Confluence solves this problem by concatenating the site's URL with the contents of {{os_destination}}. So for our above example, it would redirect you to https://jira.example.com//atlassian.com which is still an example.com site.

Alternatively, you could have any {{os_destination}} that begins with {{//}} just redirect the user to the dashboard like what is done with special characters.
fields.summary: Open redirect in JIRA in HTTPS mode only

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38074].
  {panel}

* participants = author, assignee, commenter, watcher, etc 

Ideally, the autocomplete for the @mention dialog would search these on the client first, and then go to the server for more if needed.

In the most common case for when I mention someone on a JIRA issue, that user is already a participant (has mentioned me in a previous comment etc), so its frustrating having to wait 10s of seconds for the autocomplete to return.

This is especially needed on large enterprise instances such as our very own support.atlassian.com
fields.summary: When searching for users to @Mention prioritise users who are participants in the issue already

fields.description:
Hey guys,

Just started using JIRA and Fisheye, and I'm seeing this issue on both. We use a novell, and decided to use LDAP in order to allow users to login using their credentials. But, we've been running across issues. I've logged in several times with my credentials and somehow logged in with someone else's account. Although, I still have administration rights and it doesn't seem to move it to the users I log into. Another user who is also an admin is having the same issue herself, in which she logs in with my ID somehow. Also, we have testrail and integrated JIRA. When we push a ticket to our JIRA site, it'll have the issue come up then so sometimes it'll post the ticket with different user IDs than what it's supposed to be doing. 

I've tried re-adding the LDAP settings to make sure I'm doing it right, but this issue has become a daily issue.

We are using JIRA v6.2.2 and SuSE Enterprise Server 11 SP2 (using VMWare)

Please assist! Thanks!
fields.summary: LDAP issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38066].
  {panel}

*Steps to replicate:*

1. Export any OnDemand JIRA instance
2. Import that into an Oracle DB backed JIRA BTF/Download

*More information*

Seeing this in OnDemand -> BTF exports from PostgreSQL to Oracle databases.

Here's the table definition in Oracle for jquartz_simple_triggers:
{noformat}
 CREATE TABLE JQUARTZ_SIMPLE_TRIGGERS
(
  SCHED_NAME       VARCHAR2(120 BYTE),
  TRIGGER_NAME     VARCHAR2(200 BYTE)           NOT NULL,
  TRIGGER_GROUP    VARCHAR2(200 BYTE)           NOT NULL,
  REPEAT_COUNT     NUMBER(13),
  REPEAT_INTERVAL  NUMBER(13),
  TIMES_TRIGGERED  NUMBER(13)
)
TABLESPACE JIRA_DATA
RESULT_CACHE (MODE DEFAULT)
PCTUSED    0
PCTFREE    10
INITRANS   1
MAXTRANS   255
STORAGE    (
            INITIAL          64K
            NEXT             1M
            MAXSIZE          UNLIMITED
            MINEXTENTS       1
            MAXEXTENTS       UNLIMITED
            PCTINCREASE      0
            BUFFER_POOL      DEFAULT
            FLASH_CACHE      DEFAULT
            CELL_FLASH_CACHE DEFAULT
           )
LOGGING
NOCOMPRESS
NOCACHE
NOPARALLEL
MONITORING;
{noformat}

However here's the table defintion in PostgreSQL:
{noformat}
jira=> \d jquartz_simple_triggers;
        Table "public.jquartz_simple_triggers"
     Column      |          Type          | Modifiers 
-----------------+------------------------+-----------
 sched_name      | character varying(120) | 
 trigger_name    | character varying(200) | not null
 trigger_group   | character varying(200) | not null
 repeat_count    | numeric(18,0)          | 
 repeat_interval | numeric(18,0)          | 
 times_triggered | numeric(18,0)          | 
Indexes:
    "pk_jquartz_simple_triggers" PRIMARY KEY, btree (trigger_name, trigger_group)
{noformat}

Looking at the entity definitions:
{noformat}
/opt/atlassian/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/entitydefs# grep -A 6 JQRTZSimpleTriggers entitymodel.xml
    <entity entity-name="JQRTZSimpleTriggers" table-name="JQUARTZ_SIMPLE_TRIGGERS" package-name="">
        <field name="schedName" col-name="SCHED_NAME" type="quartz-char-120"/>
        <field name="triggerName" col-name="TRIGGER_NAME" type="quartz-char-200"/>
        <field name="triggerGroup" col-name="TRIGGER_GROUP" type="quartz-char-200"/>
        <field name="repeatCount" col-name="REPEAT_COUNT" type="quartz-long-int"/>
        <field name="repeatInterval" col-name="REPEAT_INTERVAL" type="quartz-long-int"/>
        <field name="timesTriggered" col-name="TIMES_TRIGGERED" type="quartz-long-int"/>
{noformat}

In any case, because the column is shorter in Oracle than it is in PostgreSQL import failures occur when migrating from OnDemand to BTF if Oracle is utilized.

*To workaround this issue, modify the column lengths of the jquartz_simple_triggers and jqaurtz_triggers from numeric 13 to numeric 18*
fields.summary: Inconsistent column length in database tables for jquartz_simple_triggers and jquartz_triggers

fields.description:
Hi Jira,

I am writing to report a 'bug' on the 'auto assignee' problem. Although we already set up the way you instructed, which is below, the tickets are still auto assigned to one of our guys. And for some reasons, that guy actually has two names appearing in the system under the same email address.I feel this could be a problem and cause unnecessary redundancy and inconsistency to our ticketing system. 

Below is the answer you gave us before, we did exactly what you told us to. But the problem is still happening.

This is actually configured in the Administration » Projects » 'Your Project' » Roles (tab) screen - you can see in the top a Default Assignee option, which you can select "Unassigned". Just make sure the Allow unassigned issues flag is turned on in the General Configuration settings in JIRA.

I understand this is not the first time we get to you on this issue and please forgive for all those troubles. 

Feel free to call at 6463804320 for further questions or details. 

Regards,
Gabrielle Yang | Jr. Linux System Administrator | eXelate

7 West 22nd Street, 9th Floor, New York, NY 10010
fields.summary: auto assignee problem

In previous versions of JIRA (prior to 6.2) you could see a list of issues for each version on the roadmap as described in the documentation:

fields.description:
It's perfectly normal to have users without emails address, especially when you are using external authentication as Crowd or LDAP. 

By default service accounts do not have emails and as they are used for automation tasks they are not expected to be notified by anything.

{code}
2014-04-25 12:17:52,763 Sending mailitem com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem@2de476b3[issue=com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueImpl@7460fecd[id=286626,summary=overrideBallooning/TC18489: dom0 soft lockup,key=CA-133855,created=2014-04-25 01:45:46.24,updated=2014-04-25 12:16:36.083,assignee=<null>,reporter=peenus:10200],remoteUser=simonr:10200,notificationType=All_Watchers,eventTypeId=13,templateId=13] WARN ServiceRunner    Mail Queue Service [atlassian.jira.mail.MailingListCompiler] Can not send e-mail to 'svcacct_xs_xenrt' [svcacct_xs_xenrt], e-mail address ('') not set. Skipping...
{code}

Please downgrade this message to the status of INFO or even DEBUG. If an account doesn't have an email address, this is expected to be "on-purpose".

Also keep in mind that most of the time external accounts are not editable, so that would be the right approach.

If that's achievable using configuration tuning please document this, but be aware that limiting the log level to only errors is not a valid workaround.
fields.summary: users without email addresses do spam jira logs as WARNINGS -- downgrade their log level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38033].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

In LookupAliasActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl() the ActionConfiguration is cached in the private map actionAliases. There are good reasons to do that since ActionConfiguration.getActionCommand() causes a lot of requests to Configuration.get()

Though in the same thread JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.getActionConfiguration() ActionConfiguration.getActionCommand() is called again later which makes the caching less useful. JiraWebworkViewDispatcher should also call the caching code within method LookupAliasActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(). One could factor out the the caching code into a separate module and inject it in all places where ActionConfiguration is needed.

I have checked the source for 6.2.3 but likely earlier version also show this behaviour.

This is easy to fix and should make it's way into at least 6.3.x. My tests showed that the overall response time when calling a webwork action drops from 300 to 250 ms.  

Regards,
Dieter
fields.summary: JiraWebworkViewDispatcher uses noncaching method getActionConfiguration which causes peformance degradation when webwork actions are called

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce:
# create a custom field of type (Free) Text Field (single-line, multi-line, unlimited text)
# make it available on Create/Edit/View Issue screens
# create an issue and enter -1 into the field: upon creation, this field is not shown on View Issue screen
# edit the issue and enter a different value into the field (which is empty): upon update, the field is shown with the updated value
# now edit the field in-line and enter -1 again: upon saving, the field disappears

(i) Customers might want to use -1 for this type of field for some purpose and the fact that -1 is not considered a valid text is weird.

(/) A simple workaround is to use a field of Number Field type instead
fields.summary: Entering -1 into Text Field will show nothing

fields.description:
I have a workflow with two steps, Open and In Progress. 
For these two steps, I have added the {{jira.permission.assignable.group}} property to *jira-developers*. 

It works fine in the sense that when I try to assign tickets to User_A who is not in the jira-developers group, the user picker doesn't suggest that username.

But I can still assign tickets to User_A (not in the jira-developers group) by typing his username directly into the assignee field. (despite no auto-complete or suggestions)

I believe the {{jira.permission.assignable.group}} should override the project's permissions scheme ? User_A DOES have the assignable user permission, but the property configured should override the project's permission scheme and only allow jira-developers to be assigned in the Open and InProgress steps.
fields.summary: jira.permission.assignable.group property not overriding permission scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38026].
  {panel}

Our use of JIRA Agile onDemand consists of a strict association of 1 issue to 1 sprint. We use a single main board called 'Release' and we release software weekly, which is also the Sprint cadence.

Recent changes to the Sprint ID, made it such that an issue can no longer assigned to a completed sprint or removed from a completed sprint. Only active and future sprints can be selected when editing the Sprint ID.

In this specific case, I have single issue which was initially closed 1 or more weeks back, hence assigned to a now completed sprint. The issue has now been reopened and I need to update the Sprint from the old to the current open sprint. However, I cannot do that and I am only allowed to add the new sprint, not replace it to the old completed sprint. In the past this was entirely possible.

It would be advisable to allow this based on a configuration parameter or permit the change only to a select group of people (e.g. administrators).
fields.summary: Ability to remove an issue from a completed sprint or assign it to a completed sprint

fields.description:
According to the documentation [Advanced Searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching+Functions#AdvancedSearchingFunctions-membersOf()], the operator *was in* for membersOf() is not supported.
!jql_2.jpg|thumbnail!

In the first place, if the operator is not supported, JIRA should not allow you to run the JQL or at least it should throw an error. 

In this case, we were able to run the JQL {code} assignee was in (membersOf(jira-users)) {code} without any error and even returned values.
!jql_1.jpg|thumbnail!

This is so contradicting on the documentation, resulting to confusion.
fields.summary: JIRA JQL "was in membersOf()" should not be allowed to be run

fields.description:
Hi,

If using `/rest/api/2/search` with JQL to retrieve 1 or more issues with subtasks, the subtasks returned for each issue are not correctly ordered.

They seem to be ordered by date created and there is no way to change this sort order.

If however, you retrieve the same issue with subtasks via `/rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}`, the subtasks are returned in the correct order.

By 'correct order' I mean the order in which the subtasks are displayed when viewing the parent issue on its page.

Please fix so JQL searches via `/rest/api/2/search` return subtasks in the correct order.
fields.summary: REST API returns incorrect subtask ordering when using JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38009].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

Currently if you add an user as a watcher to an issue which he doesn't have "Browse Project" permission, he won't be able to receive notifications.

h3. Expected behaviour

Allow the watcher permission to work independently of the browse project permission so an user added as a watcher receives the notification even if he doesn't receive the browse project permission.

This can be useful for users who want to grant access for one ticket specifically, but not all of the tickets in the project.
fields.summary: Allow the user to be a watcher of an issue without having the browse project permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38007].
  {panel}

Hi,

We have added an HTML button (called Validar) using JavaScript code injection in the description of the field.

It has been detected than first time that the form loads the button appears correctly. However, if a reload of the form is needed (i.e.: a change in the type of issue), the form does not show the button any more.

The described behaviour can be seen in the attacched video: Custom_button_does_not_render_properly.mp4

Inspecting HTML generated code for the form it seems that the problem is that in second and subsequent reloads the JavaScript code in the description of the field is not been applied and therefore the HTML code of the button is not generated. 

Could you please give a look to this behaviour? Thanks in advance.

Regards.
fields.summary: Custom JavaScript-injected button does not render properly when reloading form

*Reproduction*
1. Go to the issue navigator screen 
2. Add the Column 'Linked Issues'. It then shows up on the right side of the screen. 
3. Drag and drop the the column 'Links' between two other columns

When the column is dropped it instantly disappears.

When I try to add the column again it appears to be still on my screen, because the box before 'Linked Issues' is checked. 
However, it remains invisible to me.

The same happens for 'Epic Links' and possibly for a few other fields, but I haven't checked them all.

The issue GHS-9796 seems to be the about the same issue, but it doesn't cover my problem with the 'Linked Issues' column.

*Workaround*
My workaround is using a custom scripted field to display the links.

fields.description:
We have a project in our JIRA where anonymous users can create issues. However, when someone tries to add an attachment, the upload bar in the _Create Issue_ screen turns red and it says "Unauthorized". When inspecting the requests in Chrome's network tab it shows we're getting a *401* response to a GET request to _/rest/auth/1_.
\\
\\
* Group (Anyone) has the following permissions in the project's scheme:
** Browse Project
** Create Issue
** Create Attachment
* Issue Security Scheme is disabled
* Reporter field is optional
* Accept remote API calls is enabled

What else could we be missing?
fields.summary: Anonymous users cannot add attachments to issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37996].
  {panel}

Due to  how JIRA is build, schema updates can happen any time when the instance is up and running especially for plugins, including third party plugins operation.

This made specific database configuration where JIRA can only use regular account that unable to updates database schema not possible.

In order to workaround this, JIRA should provide a feature that could delay all schema updates and trigger at the same time when the administrator prefer.

In regards to plugin installation process, JIRA could mark this plugin as inactive until all the necessary process to complete its installation are triggered at the same time as the other schema updates process.

*Possible Implementation*

A new queue menu under JIRA administrators could be implemented for this feature. Like Mail Queue menu, administrators have the privilege to see the pending task that need to be run and administrator can choose which task to run individually or the whole queue at the same time
fields.summary: Delay All Schema Updates and Trigger it at The Same Time

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the Windows Installer is used to upgrade a JIRA instance, it is adding an {{exit}} to the JVM arguments. In some cases it is replacing {{-XX:MaxPermSize=384m}}.

h3. Environment

* Windows Server 2003 SP2

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install JIRA 6.1.x.
# Upgrade it to 6.2.x using the Windows installer.

(i) This has also been noticed on a clean install

h3. Expected Results

It upgrades without adding anything to the JVM arguments.

h3. Actual Results

It adds an {{exit}}:

{noformat}
     JVM Input Arguments                           : -Dcatalina.base=C:\Program Files\Atlassian\JIRA -Dcatalina.home=C:\Program Files\Atlassian\JIRA -Djava.endorsed.dirs=C:\Program Files\Atlassian\JIRA\endorsed -Djava.awt.headless=true -Datlassian.standalone=JIRA -Dmail.mime.decodeparameters=true -Dorg.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER=true -Djava.io.tmpdir=C:\Program Files\Atlassian\JIRA\temp -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager -Djava.util.logging.config.file=C:\Program Files\Atlassian\JIRA\conf\logging.properties -XX:MaxPermSize=384m exit -Xms256m -Xmx768m
{noformat}

In some cases it appears that {{-XX:MaxPermSize=384m}} is being replaced. This was identified in support cases and has not been replicated by Atlassian (yet).

h3. Workaround

# Stop JIRA.
# Remove the {{exit}} and add {{-XX:MaxPermSize=384m}} (if it doesn't already exist) as per [Setting Properties and Options on Startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+Properties+and+Options+on+Startup].
# Start JIRA.
fields.summary: Upgrading JIRA with the Windows Installer adding exit to the JVM arguments

The Jira system time displayed at Jira Administration > System > System info > System Time is incorrect according to the system time established. This is the time used when creating a new issue. The configured time zone is GMT-5 or America/Lima but all issues are created with creation time 5h ago.

I have already tried:
- Configured Jira default time zone
- Verified linux "date" returned correct datetime
- Followed solution for first scenario from https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA's+Timestamp+Doesn't+Match+the+System+Time (see attachment: java-parameters.png)

More details on current Jira installation:
Version 6.2
Version number: 6252
OS: CentOS 6
Database HSQL

fields.description:
If an user has defined a different timezone in the user profile "added a comment" and "logged work" appear to localize correctly according to the user timezone, but the events with "made changes" show the default/server timezone.
Interestingly, on mouseover it appears to display the correctly localised time.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Configure the Default timezone (eg: GMT-03:00)
# Create a new user, and browse to this user profile to specify a different timezone to this user (eg: GMT+08:00)
# Modify some issues and check the time stamp with this user in question.
# Check the made changes in the "All" section, it will show the default time, however, it you put the mouseover, it will show the user correct timezone.

h3. Expected behaviour:

It should show the user timezone without the need to put the mouseover.
fields.summary: Timestamp for made changes shows the default system timezone.

fields.summary: Jira crashed while trying to upgrade Jira Agile.

fields.description:
See attached recording.

I had to save this bug twice because the first time I saved it I didn't save it with the attachment. And JIRA doesn't for some reason let me add an attachment after the fact (as it does when I use it internally at my company). Is that known issue in and of itself? Probably by choice maybe to limit file storage?
fields.summary: I couldn't save an Avatar image.
I couldn't save an Avatar image.

fields.description:
I've posted this question last week in support but I haven't received any response, so I'm going to assume it's a bug.

We recently migrated to JIRA from Redmine. We are using Google Apps to access our JIRA accounts. The accounts were created using the import,but the created account names map to user names of Google Apps.  We have 25 licenses for JIRA but only 10 for confluence. I'm able to log into JIRA if my user account has access to both JIRA and Confluence configured. However, for accounts that only have JIRA configured, they are unable to login. Once I grant these accounts access to Confluence, they are able to log in.

fields.description:
This is a problem both for the Issue Navigator and the JIRA Issues Macro available in Confluence.

h3. Workaround

To work around this issue, call the filter by number and apply the sort at the time of use. Example:

{code}filter = 47420 ORDER BY priority DESC{code}

As reported by a customer:

{quote}An Employee created a search filter. 
When run it includes the ORDER BY priority DESC.
If you go to the full url of the search string it works as expected, and you can click on the P column to sort by priority. Given the operator in the filter it appears properly as descending.
If within Jira you do a search filter="some sumber"
It displays the tickets, however the priority is not shown in DESC order. There is no way of course to click on it either. 
This is causing issues as we use the Jira macro to list jira tickets based on a filter. While prior with wiki mark up we could add operators, this is not possible now.
In this case with the Jira macro it truncates the url to filter="some number"
This is an issue as we want to display the list properly sorted based on the search criteria. We are able to replicate this in Jira, but creating a filter, then doing a search with filter="Some number"{quote}

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Manage Filters
# Identify the filterid of any filter
# Go to the Issue Navigator
-# In Advanced mode, enter filter=<id>
# Compare to the results of clicking through to the filter from Manage Filters
fields.summary: Filter Id based searches are not preserving the ORDER BY sort order clause

fields.description:
In JIRA 6.1.5, users receive email notifications in the correct language defined by their user profile language in JIRA, for all events.

In JIRA 6.2.2, some of the events are still displayed in the correct language, including:
* Issue Created
* Issue Updated (e.g. change issue's description, change assignee)
* Issue Closed
* Issue Reopened
!correct.png|thumbnail!

However, some other events are always displayed in English, no matter what the system language or user profile language is, including:
* Issue Commented
* Issue Comment Edited
* Issue Resolved
* Work Started On Issue
!incorrect.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Wrong translations in email notifications

fields.description:
As of JIRA 6.0, JIRA introduced a new table to manage usernames: app_user. With this, all references to user names are now in lowercase.
* https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Renamable+Users+in+JIRA+6.0

h4. Problem
After upgrade from a previous version to 6.0+, users are not able to manage their old attachments. They are also not seen as owners of the attachments.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
* Have JIRA 5.x
* Ensure that users can only have *Delete Own Attachments* and not the 'Delete All Attachments'
* Log in as an user with capital letters in the username (e.g. Testuser)
* Attach a file to a ticket
** Notice that it can be managed/removed
* Upgrade JIRA to 6.x
* View the same attachment, as Testuser
* Notice that it cannot be managed/removed
* Newly attached files can be managed just fine.

h4. Cause
The problem is that the *fileattachment* table is not properly updated to reflect the lowercase references. With that, users are not associated to their older attachments, thus cannot manage them.

In the database, notice the following:
{code}
jira622=# select id, issueid, filename, created, author from fileattachment ;
  id   | issueid |          filename           |          created           |  author  
-------+---------+-----------------------------+----------------------------+----------
 10002 |   10000 | how-to-draw-godzilla-16.gif | 2014-04-17 12:59:11.845-07 | admin
 10003 |   10000 | n60mXA5.gif                 | 2014-04-17 13:02:57.969-07 | testuser
 10001 |   10000 | 1313889118993.jpg           | 2014-04-16 12:58:52.348-07 | Testuser
(3 rows)
{code}
* notice the authors:
** the old attachment is listed with author "Testuser"
** the new attachment is listed as "testuser"

h4. Workaround
* Update the database and change the author names to be lowercase
or
* Have an account that is able to "Delete All Attachments" help manage old attachments
fields.summary: Upgrade to JIRA 6 causes users to be unable to remove old attachments
